defs: (pros.) a unit consisting of a definite number of syllables.
(pros.) a rule regulating the number, kind of prosodic groups in a line of a verse; a prosodic rule.
(pros.) a verse constructed as per prosodic rules.
(pros.) a kind of verse, governed by prosodic units.
(pros.) a verse, governed by prosodic rules regarding number and kinds of groups of syllables which have specific combination of prosodic units.
(pros.) one of the varieties of verses that are governed by prosodic rules regarding number and kinds of groups of syllables which have specific combination of prosodic units.
(pros.) a short syllable that is regarded a single unit.

the practice or an instance of falsely presenting an appearance of virtue or falsely professing a belief to which one's own character or conduct does not conform; dissimulation, pretence; hypocrisy.
a magician by profession.
a person who habitually cheats others; a cheat.
